intro: Barleria kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro barleria, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the cool, arid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with a similar climate.
